For the city of Phoenix, construction projects that are done in conjunction with private development,  the certificate of occupancy or certificate of completion is withheld until the site is cleaned up.  If the work is in the right-of-way, the bond is held as well.  There are no bonds for work on private property.

author: David Dillner
text:
Do any of you require contractors to provide the City with a "mud and dust bond" that the City may draw on if the contractor does not pick-up after himself? The example that I have been given is a contractor, by hauling construction materials through town, has left debris on public rights-of-way. If the contractor does not pick it up, the City would pick it up and then bill the work to the contractor. If the contractor failed to pay the invoice, the City would draw off of the bond.
If you have something like this, please send/provide the instrument and ordinance.
Thanks in advance.
David Dillner
City of Edgerton, KS
title: "Mud and Dust Bond"
